intro: Cuphea peplidioides, commonly known as the silverleaf cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant belongs to the Lythraceae family, which includes other ornamental plants such as the poinsettia. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements make it an attractive addition to both residential and commercial settings.
